data.title: Great Lock and Great customer service
data.body: I have 3 of these locks. Very easy to install. Very functional and good looking. The 3rd lock that I ordered could not be programmed properly. I contacted Kwikset, they take your through the programming procedure. When that did not resolve the issue that replaced the unit. Just upload photos of the unit. Excellent and quick service.

data.title: Excellent, Easy to install
data.body: We were in need of an interior lock with a keypad and this fit the bill. Kwikset is a solid brand, and what I like about them is the easy re-keying system. That way whenever you get a new lock you dont have to worry about finding a locksmith to come and redo everything, or if youre in need of a new key, you dont have to buy a whole new lock. This one is easy to install, and most importantly, easy to program. I think I had it up and running within minutes. The keys are easy to push and it works every time. We have it set to automatically lock, but I believe this is an optional feature so you can turn it off if you need to.

data.title: Quality product!
data.body: Very nice quality. Easy to install and program. I could not be more pleased with this lock.

data.title: Does not lock from inside to outside.
data.body: I love this lock! The quality is great. Easy to install BUT you can not lock it so kids can’t get out of the house. I actually have a dog that can open doors and there is no way to lock it so he can’t escape. Some of their older keyless locks do and I have one. But it is no longer available. So I had to put a child proof door latch below the handle so the dog or a child can’t pull it down and open the door. You can push the lever up to open which my dog hasn’t figured out yet. I know they say it’s code to be able to exit a room on fire but children and animals can get out unless there is another child proof latch somewhere on the door. Not a good idea.

data.title: A Solid Non-Networked Keyless Entry System
data.body:
This is the commercial classed unit from Kwikset, there is a residential version 917. They are nearly identical except for, I believe, the decorative design and the BHMA certifications. The residential is Grade 2, the commercial is Grade 3. What that actually means, I have no idea. I honestly purchased the 955 instead of 917 because it was, at the time, 30 dollars cheaper.

I installed this on the door between my garage and laundry room replacing a round knob by EZ-Set (a discount sub-brand of Kwikset made in Taiwan that uses Kwikset KW1 keys- this is important,) The mechanism goes in easily. Programming the unit is straightforward and the lever handle makes life easier for aging hands.

The Kwikset mechanism includes Emergency Egress- meaning you can open the door from the inside if it locked or unlocked. This is true of the 955 commercial model and the 917 residential version. Both versions also require you to keep the key engaged to open the door. You can't 'unlock' the door, then remove your key then open. You unlock, keep the key turned and open at the same time. If you remove your key, the door re-locks.

Awkward things to take note of:
1. No matter how hard you try, this unit will end up installed slightly tilted if you tighten the bolts properly.
2. When putting the exterior door handle on (the one with the key hole) you must insert the key and keep the tumblers unlocked to access the set screw. It took me nearly 10 minutes to figure that out.
3. The Amazon stock is probably not too fresh. The 9 volt battery included in my package was completely dead on arrival. I installed a new Energizer 9 volt and it works fine. Note, the description on the Amazon website says it uses AA batteries, that is incorrect. There is a single 9 volt on the non-keypad side of the lock under a cover that slides up.

Now, the reason making note of the EZ-Set lock being replaced. Kwikset has this neat tech called "SmartKey" which will let you rekey your locks without having to pay a locksmith. In the instructions, they have you put the whole thing together then go back and take the exterior handle off to perform the re-key. You don't have to- you can re-key before assembling at the start. But here's the thing, your 'master' key must use Kwikset KW1 type keys. And in my case, our house keys (our entire house uses the same key on all doors) were EZ-Set, a sub-brand of Kwikset and uses... KW1 keys. So I happily re-keyed the new 955 lock to my existing house key.

We've been using the new handle since the day after Christmas 2023 (it was a gift) and now look around the house thinking about replacing all of the old, round knobs with levers and will probably put another of this model on at least one exterior door.

data.title: Excellent and better than most locks.
data.body: This is a great numeric lock. The only thing is it ain’t a smart lock! Otherwise it’s pretty solid. After returning 3 smart locks this worked like a charm!

data.title: Kwikset makes great products and stands behind their stuff
data.body:
I have multiple Kwikset locks installed around my home. One of the smart lock (Smartcode 912) was stated experiencing issue locking and locking using the keypad after 6 years of daily usage. I ordered this SmartCode 955 to replace the 912 and it is even easier to install than the 912.
I reached out to Kwikset support just to make sure I cover all the bases in troubleshooting my old 912 (not expecting it be covered under warranty) Kwikset support worked with me to determine the issue is covered under warranty and is shipping me a new unit. I am totally impressed with how promptly the support person (Diana M.) communicated with me and how painless the whole process was. For sure I will continue to use Kwikset products and highly recommend them. :)

data.title: Love
data.body: Easy install, looks nice, multi layer security options. Very happy with it

data.title: almost commercial quality
data.body: My only issue was tightening the set screw to hold the interior handle on; set screw would not turn; had to return and get a new set; set screw seems to have been a problem in the past; used BILT app for installation instructions.

data.title: Easy to install and program
data.body: Works great. Easy to install and program. The only problem is the key pad is small. My husband is newly blind and might have problems navigating the buttons.

data.title: Easy to install, reliable, works great
data.body: I would buy this again if I had another exterior door. Unfortunately I do not.

data.title: Probably the best non-wifi pushbutton lock
data.body:
This lock is well built quality, very solid especially the latch mechanism. Programming is a little weird but you get used to it (leave the paperwork near the lock someplace).

I wish Kwikset had a wifi capable unit of this same quality. It is nice to be able to monitor and operate the lock remotely as well as program the lock from a phone.

I had to replace my wifi enabled lock with this lock since the wifi locks do not take kindly to the weather (when screen is wet or thumb is wet, those locks do not work) and many of those locks do not have a mechanical lock disable lever to leave the lock open when around the house.

data.title: Install an operation of my new lock
data.body: Very easy to install. Also like easy programming. Simple operation works great.

data.title: *Almost* perfect
data.body: This review would have received 5 stars, but I’m thinking that anyone with a storm door has experienced what I have. We just installed it tonight, and while we were testing to make sure the codes worked, we shut the door and became “stuck” inside. The door handle would NOT turn so we could open the door. We take some hardware off/apart, assume it’s an issue with the latch and some things not lining up. When some minor adjustments didn’t solve the issue, we realize that the paint has been scraped off the front of the brand new door handle. The handle sticks out so far that it was catching/scraping on the storm door handle and prevented us from shutting the door all the way without forcing it shut. We forced it shut to troubleshoot the issue, before realizing the damage it was causing the new handle. Long story short, we have to keep the storm door propped open, hoping the wind doesn’t blow it off, until we can grind off some of the handle so that it doesn’t grind/stick against the storm door handle. I recommend *carefully* measuring the space you have between the storm door handle with the length of the new handle..

data.title: Works well
data.body: Works well. Easy install.

data.title: Installed within 30 minutes
data.body: Best automatic door lock out there. Easy install.

data.title: Best keyless entry
data.body: Simple and works!!

data.title: THIS is the door lock you want. No complicated apps or WiFi-Bluetooth needed
data.body:
If you want a straight forward, easy to use passcode lock, this is the one for you!!! I have installed 4 of these at this point. Set up / install only takes about 15-20 min. Wasn’t bad at all!!
Door 1 - My parents are at the age where they dont want complicated or confusing apps for everything, they can easily put in their code I programmed for them and it never gives them issues.
Door 2 - At my sisters home, she wanted a secure and easy way for the kids to get into the house after school and not have to worry if any of the kids lost there key again.
Door 3 - I have mine installed on my gaming room / Office door so that when im not at home, my niece or nephews cannot go in their and possibly break any of my expensive logo sets or collectors items. as well as, if i working in the office , they can’t barge in and interrupt a work zoom call or bother me while im working.
Door 4 - My mom has her own sugar cookie business and To ensure non of the grandkids sneak in and eat them, we put one on the cookie room door.
The battery on these last way longer than any lock I’ve had that used AA or AAA battery’s. Its been 2 years since installing the one on my game room and still have yet to need to change the battery

data.title: Great item
data.body: I'm very pleased with this item

data.title: Excellent product!
data.body: I like that the battery can be changed without taking the unit apart. Simple installation however follow the directions carefully, particularly lining up & tightening the set screw when you install the outside handle.

data.title: Design flaw
data.body: Nice hardware, but because it’s black you can’t easily see if it’s locked or unlocked. Had to mark the lever with a metal ink pen. Something the manufacturer should have thought of.

data.title: Can’t go wrong with kwikset brand
data.body:
Play Video
I’ve been using this lock on my garage door for over 1.5 years and the quality is so great. It looks just as good as the first day I purchased it. I love the added security to my home with the lock set. I have kwikset on my front door too (a different model) and I love the combo of the two and being able to use the same home key for both if the battery is ever down for the product.

data.title: Easy to install
data.body: I didn’t have any troubles installing it. I would have bought more but a little pricey

data.title: Exactly what we wanted
data.body: Simple and straight to the point, easy to install and easy to use and looks great.

data.title: Great
data.body: Fairly easy install. Works well.

data.title: Quality
data.body: First off I read reviews …and for the guys that gave a 1 star showing pictures I laughed you read the instructions…that set screw with a tiny little star u don’t need a wrench on that u come up from underneath hole…oh it looks solid doesn’t it Man U think now u have to drill a hole no no guys u slide the handle on yes it’s universal solid part is facing up hole side is down opposite of set screw…back to task u put the handle on put the key yes a key turn the key horizontal walla hey now there’s a hole to slide Allen key up inside the key lock to tighten the set screw very easy a 10 year old could figure it out but read the instructions first lay it put battery in set your codes on the table unhook wire and install …I was excited to get mine cause like all people keys are a bummer…but if the battery goes dead carry or hide the key somewhere Goodluck nice doorlock

data.title: Easy to use and inatall
data.body: As long as you’re not a total doofus, this thing is pretty easy to install and set up. Makes it really nice so I don’t have to carry an extra key and it’s easy to let somebody in… Just give them the combo. I would recommend.

data.title: KWIKSET SMARTCODE 955 KEYLESS DOOR
data.body: THIS IS GREAT AND EASY TO SET UP. WILL BUY AGAIN

data.title: Very easy to set up
data.body: Happy that Kwikset offered the bolt collar for a non chiseled door. The instructions were simple to understand and install was easy.

data.title: just what we need
data.body: what we need for our clinics to keep it private

data.title: Missing Screw is NOT Missing
data.body:
This is less of a review and more to help others as I did not see anyone on a review or response to a question answer this with any clarity.

Many are leaving bad reviews on this because it is missing the screw that keeps the interior handle on. I spent a good amount of time looking for this missing screw. Going through the bags and the box just knowing this thing came out but it was not there. I decided after getting heated to go to the product page and search for others having the same issue. I saw one person who stated to read the instructions carefully because the screw is not easy to see.

I looked over the instructions and you will notice on Step 4 part B that it shows you putting in the key and turning it (this is with the handle on) I gave this a shot. I put the key in and turned the key to the right. Nothing really happened but if you leave the key like that and take the Allen wrench and put it in the hole at the bottom where the screw should be and it will go in there a little ways you will notice that it magically catches something. You then turn it and it will tighten against the handle and your problem is solved.

Another reviewer stated that the hole is partially drilled but that is not the case. That is a little spot where it catches from the inside when you tighten that screw.

The exterior handle has a screw already in place as well but it is easy to work. Just put the handle on and use the Allen wrench to tighten.

NOTE: The screws on things like this usually are put on after the handle or are already in the handle. These do not work like this. They are on the shaft and you actually turn the screw from the inside with the handle on and as you loosen the screw it presses against the handle which holds it in place. So the hole where the screw goes is really just a hole to put the Allen wrench in and tighten the hidden screw.

I know that my comments may not be the best when it comes to instructions and I am sorry for that, but it will help more than vague replies, reviews and instructions. Also if someone else has posted this I am sorry as I did not see this at the time I left this review.

I thought about giving this a 4 star because of the lack of instructions, however it really is not the case. If others (including myself) read the instructions fully it will tell you. I just assumed I knew and had it figured out. Clearly I did not. So I can see both sides of this when people want to say their point of view. Just keep in mind, that the screw or screws are there. They both are different in ways when it comes to how you tighten them and they are already installed on the shafts that the handles/knobs go on.

Thanks
Chris

data.title: Looked forever
data.body: Took forever to choose a lock. I love this one!

data.title: Good lock set. Numbers easy to see if pressed
data.body:
We have replaced all 3 of our old electronic locks in the house with the Kwikset SmartCode 955 Keyless Keypad Door Auto Lock. The locks we had previously worked ok for 1 or 2 years then became difficult to push the buttons just right to have them make contact.

The Kwickset buttons are large enough and spaced far enough apart to allow use with gloves on. The beep made when the buttons are pressed is very easy to hear. Also note that the battery can be replaced without tools. Our old lock required complete disassembly.

We have had one of these installed on a primary door used multiple times per day for the last 1.5 years with no problems.

data.title: fast service
data.body: nice heavy duty looks like it will last for years to come. un like the one that i brought a cheaper brand

data.title: Great Keyless door lock
data.body: I'm very satisfied with this attractive, secure, well made and easily installed door lock.

data.title: Careful rekeying lock!
data.body: I like the lock and its features. More complex than I expected. Be careful if you plan to rekey the lock. It is different than other Kwikset rekey able locks. The door handle must be removed before rekeying. I wish that this notice were a little more prominent in the directions being that the rekeyability is one of the main reasons I went with this lock. Ended up messing up the lock and needed to return it for exchange. Fortunately, Kwikset was willing to take it back.

data.title: Works good
data.body: My only complaint is that you have to remember to flip the lever on the inside or if you step outside you will have to enter the code to get in. But that’s the lock just doing its job

data.title: Combination door handles.
data.body: Easy to install.

data.title: Great lock
data.body:
Play Video
Very pleased. Works and looks great.

Couple points.. one review complained handle falls off. They obviously didn't read instructions. You have to insert key and turn lock to access screw to tighten outside handle. A little unintuitive but it's right there in the instructions.

Also, I don't believe you can lock this from outside without key. However same was true for old school original simple knob lock so I didn't see as big deal.

Also, this is not a smart wifi connected lock. It's standalone.

data.title: Kwikset locks
data.body: Easy to use

data.title: Works great on my shop
data.body: I did not want to have to carry keys to access my shop. This is a great solution. Battery life is unknown yet.

data.title: Love this entry door knob
data.body: I love this door knob. It looks great and is easy to use. I was over hiding a key and trying to find it in the dark. We did have to shim the storm door frame out a bit or else the knob hit the storm door. A little inconvenience for a lovely upgrade.

data.title: I’ve purchased 3 of these
data.body: I’ve had a lot of electronic locks and this one is my favorite. I like the backlit and well raised numbers but most importantly I love that I can turn the auto lock feature on and off manually via the knob on the back. I’ve bought others that required an app for this setting and it wasn’t useful when I needed it. There is a Kwikset app that will show you the status, battery level and let you lock and unlock but you generally have to be so close it’s not super helpful unless your sitting area is near your front door. Overall it’s good enough to buy three times over.

data.title: Great product. Fast, easy, simple setup
data.body: Very simple to setup. Solid craftsmanship. Love it

data.title: Easy to install and works
data.body: Easy to install and works like a charm...love the simplicity of the design. However the handle on both sides wobble even after tightening it to the max ...This must change or sit snug tight..worried it may fall off any time.

data.title: Great Keypad entry door
data.body:
Bought a cheaper model before this one. It was a nightmare. This one, installed easy, programs so easy, and has a latch inside to go in and out of “passage mode”. (Normally, the door knob will lock every time. When latch is turned to passage mode, the door knob will not lock)
P.S.- Among other issues, that cheaper model did not have this feature. Who wants to have to unlock the door every time you go through it.

data.title: Best door knob kwikset has made
data.body: Without a doubt this is their best design yet.

data.title: Worked great
data.body: Easy install and works perfectly

data.title: Promote the person who designed it
data.body:
By far- without a doubt- the easiest lock I have installed in a long time. I went through 3 different locks (one being a Schlage) until I found this lock.

Installed with zero issues. Easy instructions and very simple parts that connected flawlessly. The provided battery was icing on the cake.

I am cautiously optimistic the lock and battery will last for awhile. Time will tell. Promote the person who engineered this thing.

data.title: Where’s the WiFi?
data.body: Easy to install replacing an existing Kwikset. Needed to match existing hardware. Unfortunately there is no WiFi solution matching our install. Hence the 4 star rating.

data.title: Solid- but Set screw missing/not threaded
data.body: Solid manufacturing, heavier duty than other Kwikset lock I had previously. Easier to change battery but was disappointed when it appeared the factory had not threaded and set the set screw on outside handle.

data.title: I feel safe and secure in my office now
data.body: I really like that we have this in our office. We have a lot of expensive stuff in the office and that can be from money to expensive equipment and just in in general feeling protected. It was easy to create the code, and it automatically walks for you that way also it makes it easy for our employees to go to the office without having to get a key, they just need to remember the code.

data.title: Great lock but stopped working after about 90 days - needs longer warranty period
data.body:
Overall, this seems to be a great product. I have had Kwikset locks before and this one is no different, very sturdy, easy to install and easy to set up.

My frustration with this lock is that it stopped working after about 90 days (and just outside of the warranty).

The lock is installed on an outside steel door in a storage building and I am not there all the time. After installing it worked great and allowed me to not have to worry about having my keys with me when I get to the building. The lock worked great for the first few months but during one of my visits, the lock made a strange, repetitive beeping noise that made me think the battery was draining. A bit shot on the life span in my opinion but sometimes it happens. My next time to the building, the lock no longer worked, and I replaced the battery with a brand new, unopened 9V. Unfortunately, that apparently was not the problem as the keypad still does not work. I have been on the manufacturer website and have attempted to request support but have not had luck thus far.

Fortunately, the key still works so I am not completely locked out, but having a non-functioning keypad defeats the purpose of a keyless lock.

I REALLY want to like this lock as it seems well made, but until I have better luck in getting some technical support, I will continue to be slightly frustrated.

I will close with, 90 days seems to be a very short warranty period on a product of this type.

data.title: Oh My God, it doesn't always open
data.body: This lock looks beautiful but it us temperamental. Sometimes, too often, lock won't respond to code. I have to keep the key handy, locked out 2xs. Expensive to install, so stuck!

data.title: Love it!
data.body: This has been one of the best additions to our Airbnb. Reliable, consistent, easy to install and program.

data.title: Easy to install and make life easier
data.body: This was so easy to install. I am a little handy but these instructions were spot on. My teen daughter helped and we felt super accomplished. My son kept coming in at night forgetting to lock the door. The option of auto lock is perfect. Why did I not do this years ago.

data.title: Doorknob fell
data.body:
Play Video
Another reviewer included a video and details of how hers fell off. Same happened to our front door. It took me a few searches to figure out how to fix it. The screw is not visible and it was kinda jammed. You have to put the handle back, insert the key in, turn it 90 degrees - that will clear the path for you to tighten it up. Included a video. Still reduced some stars because this happening a year after it was installed seems too fast.

data.title: Broke almost immediately
data.body: I was really disappointed with this product. I purchased two of them and then hired a professional to install them. A month later, the handle fell off, and I got multiple emails from people telling me the screw was inside and it could not have possibly have fallen out. But then I had two professionals look at it, and there was absolutely no screw inside, as I told them. I convinced them to send me a new one and it’s been about a week and it’s still not here. They could have rush ordered it for me considering the situation. I find it very easy to open and close, and I like that you can program numbers for other people since I have workers in my apartment at the moment for a renovation. That said, I had a really hard time programming it at first and felt like one of them in particular, gave me a really rough time and did not work as it was supposed to for the first few tries at programming. I was really happy with the price but a cheaper price doesn’t mean that you should be getting a product that falls off your door a month later. It’s not like a door handle is important to open the lock, right?

data.title: Literally KEYLESS & missing many parts! Item is used!
data.body:
Updated: Contacted Kwikset about the issues. Customer support is very responsive and empathetic. She opened a case and in a week a replacement unit came through the mail. This lock is perfect for my needs. Installed it on my interior door to the kitchen from the garage. You can assign multiple user code or program a one time code for single access. Thus, I have upgraded the rating to 4 stars.
——————————
I have a 2 story 5 year old, four bedroom house with a total of 37 Kwikset locks, dumb knobs, interior and walk in closet doors and deadbolts. I purchased this electronic Kwikset lock because of the keyless capabilities and most importantly the smart rekey feature. It also goes with the lever type old brushed bronze design of my home’s existing door knobs.

I’ve never been so disappointed with a product that I wish there was an option for a no star rating. This lock set was advertised as “like new” with open box and minor cosmetics imperfections. The product arrived with dings and dents on the lever. Visible signs that this was heavily used and was once in another person’s home. I was disappointed but not a big deal, I end up touching up the scratched and dinged surfaces. The install should have been straight forward but became challenging because the instruction manual that came in the box is only in Spanish!

Allen key to secure the levers were missing, some screws were missing but the most aggravating part there was no key! The lever on the inside of the house is missing the center cap so there is this ugly gaping hole. I can’t even master the key to my preferred key master. How can you do it when there was no supplies keys in the lock? You need the lock’s key to re-key the door knob.

I found this out only after installing the door lock. I am calling Amazon and Kwikset tomorrow.

data.title: Able to rekey
data.body: It was great that I was able to rekey to match the other locks on the door and screen door!! I only need one key now for all the locks!

data.title: Works well. (Ignore that video someone put of it being defeated, they installed it wrong!)
data.body:
Even if you have never put in a door lock, you can do this if you are replacing an existing lockset. There are only two long screws to get your old lock off and you will see how it all works as you take it apart.
I was impressed by the options this lock had, I opted to have mine re-lock each time, and disabled the inside manual lock. Also, since my other house door lock is Kwikset, I was able to re-key this lock to use that same key! I didn't even know you could get locks that you could re-key yourself. So if you're already are using kwikset locks your other key will likely be compatible.
It seems as sturdy as the lock it replaced.
Someone has a warning video about at least one version of this lock that it can be easily opened by sliding in a thin blade and pushing back the latch. THEY HAVE NOT FOLLOWED INSTRUCTIONS. All latch (not deadbolt) locks like this have a little pin on the flatside of the latch, and you mount your strike plate so that when the door is closed, that pin is retracted. When retracted, the latch can't be just pushed in. Go try it on a similar lock.
But if you mount your strikeplate with a lot of play and that pin has room to be out, then the latch is able to be pushed in, otherwise you couldn't lock your door and then close it.
The photo I'm showing you the pin. Your old lock you are replacing will be the same. So no, you can't just push something thin in the jamb and push the latch back, like in the misleading video. There is a youtube video explaining this too but I can't put a link here or the review gets rejected. Try a youtube search "door latch dead latching feature".

data.title: Great deadbolt
data.body: Easy to install and key to other house locks

data.title: Great quality, horrible customer service
data.body: I just installed this lock and the process is pretty straightforward. This was my first time installing a lock and it went pretty smooth. The quality is great and I love the product. The only issue was customer service. I needed help with resetting the keypad code, but the customer service was very rude and hung up on me after the first round of his instructions didn’t work work. I almost decided to return the lock since this was the first time I called and their agent didn’t have the patience to even answer one question. I did more research and was able to find what I needed, but I hope I never have to call them again.

data.title: I really love this programmable lock
data.body: I love this! It’s the 3rd one we’ve installed. We now don’t carry house or shop keys with us everywhere. It tales about 40 minutes to install, and you need to follow the directions carefully. Especially when setting the key lock to match your existing ones. Just have patience. Overall, a very good product. We’ve had one for over 2 years and never had a problem. The battery is easy to replace, and last about a year. It has a ver pleasing look aesthetically.

data.title: Can't program pin
data.body: I purchased 3 of these. Only two out of the three will allow me to program the pin to unlock the doors. I have googled the heck out of it and followed the directions to reset it. But it just doesn't want to work. Other two seem to be working fine. Other than that they are pretty good quality. I have one that will not stay straight on the door. Little sideways. Tighten it and then week later its crocked again. I like kwickset but this one is bugging me a bit.

data.title: Very easy to install!
data.body: Prior to this, I have replaced exactly 1 doorknob in my life. Directions are very clear and install is quick (~20 mins with my inexperience). I love having keyless entry!

data.title: Good garage door lock
data.body: I got a little nervous about leaving my house door access from garage unlocked but also didn't want to have to fumble around for my keys and remember to lock my door all the time. This keyless lock automatically locks the door when I close it and always works (so far).

data.title: Great
data.body: I wanted one for my storage building so I didn't have to take a key with me all the time cuz I don't use it everyday. And if it works good and I like it I plan to put one on my garage and house doors. The reason I decided on this lock was I know from past experience Kwickset makes good quality locks. I Also liked the idea of being able to easily rekey the locks so I can use one key for all the locks. I removed the old lock and installed the Kwickset lock probably 20 minutes or so. It was easy to program. I just installed one code for basic operation. It seems to be well made, and good quality. Highly recommended.

data.title: installed easily
data.body: We live in area where we dont lock our doors. one day my wife was taking a nap and her father came in and woke her from nap she was enjoying. We are have seven grown kids and naps were very precious then. Now its not as critical, but getting woken up is still not pleasant. She told her father that this had better be important but I dont think the message came across. Turns out he just wanted to chat. His wife left for Kentucky, or Tennessee somewhere that area of the country some weeks ago to visit her sister. I think she needed a break from her husband if you know what I mean... My wife asked to start locking the front door. I told her the lock does not work correctly. Instead of fixing it, I replaced it with the kind you can program with a code. Now our front door is always locked. After I installed the knew door knob, I oiled up the old one and works fine, will save it for my next project. I got a good deal on the price. I actually went to Lowes and then compared the price at Amazon, saved $15 and next day delivery. What a deal! It arrived the next day but my wife and I werent home because we went away for our 40th wedding anniversary to Bestwestern in Oakhurst CA. We took the chihuahua (Naomi) and cost extra $50 a night. Best motel ive ever stayed in.

data.title: Very impressive quality
data.body: This lock is the real deal. High quality paint and heavy made. Super simple to install with literally a screw driver and the enclosed hex wrench. Once installed, it feels and looks bulletproof! Super simple to program as well. I’ve owned a Schlage for years and absolutely hated it because the mechanism was loud and to change the battery, you had to remove the entire handle. Not with the Quickset 955. The 9v battery (included) can easily be changed from the inside behind a little door that slides off. Given my experience with another brand, the battery I expect will last at least a year or more under normal use. Very satisfied with this product!

data.title: Check the hardware before you start.
data.body: I bought two Kwikset 955. The first one was installed with not problems. I follow the instructions and it took from start to finish about 1 1/2 hours. I would have given a rating of 5 stars. Then I installed the other one, made model. I figure maybe 1/2 the time since I was familiar to the procedure. I was wrong. The unit was almost finish, with the second handle set to go on. Simple, just turn is setscrew a half turn and I go on to the program the codes. The trouble began, the setscrew was defective. In Alien Wrench was not working, missing the slot in the setscrew, because it was not there. The setscrew was flat. I tried for about 1/2 hour to get it to turn, and nothing worked. The only course of action is to pack the up and return it from a replacement.. I would gave given the rate is 3 stars for this second one. It is a fine product, but check the setscrew, out the box, before you start.

data.title: Great
data.body: A replacement for a previous Quickset lock. Quickset is my go to for locks.

data.title: Easy instal, very nice function
data.body: I bought two of these for two front doors. Installation was very easy. Instructions were well written. I installed it, programmed it, and rekeyed it in about 30 minutes. I absolutely love it. Unfortunately I have to return one because there isn’t room for the storm door to close on the second door. If you have a storm door keep that in mind. Otherwise, I wish I could use the second one and really like the one I can use.

data.title: As advertised
data.body: It has been 3 months and it is exactly what i wanted, and works as advertised, i will update if anything comes up.

data.title: Screen/Storm door
data.body: Great lock, however if installing with a storm/screen door the handle sticks out to far the door to latch if you have another door behind it. KWIKSET needs to redesign the length of the handles.

data.title: Great door knob!
data.body:
I made a minor mistake a few months back. We have a 6 year old who like most 6 year olds love to go inside and outside every 30 seconds. While we, the adults, are outside, the 6 year old loved to lock the door behind them. Not a terrible habit for a 6 year old to have living in the city, but it's a real pain when you don't have your keys on you. So I bought a seemingly affordable electronic door knob. It worked okay for a short time, then the mechanism sometimes would do its job so you'd have to enter the code again. This increased as time went on, so...I bought THIS door knob to replace it. The few bucks more I spent, I'd wished I'd done sooner. This door knob feels so much more sturdy, and most of all, always works when codes are entered properly.

The smart key feature was an added bonus. The keys I had made for the household with the last electronic door knob were easily made to work with this door knob, if I'm remembering correctly, it's an SW1 keyset. I didn't realize this doorknob had this feature, I never cared about this feature, but...I'm glad it had it, and I'm glad it was compatible with my existing keys. (No immediate trips to the hardware store for me)

Great product, splurge a few bucks and get this, I highly recommend it.

data.title: Ok
data.body: We have had key less entries before, but this model does not automatically lock after 30 seconds. That was disappointing since we have a son that always forgets to lock doors.

data.title: Give yourself some time.
data.body:
Addendum: Lowered to 3 stars. All of my other electronic locks relock with pushing the button above the keypad. This one stays locked or unlocked and requires you to open the door, reach around and turn the locking knob to permanently set the lock.

The physical install went great. In ten minutes I had the old fixture out and the new one in. This is the 12 electronic door look I've installed. I've used six each of two different brands. It may be that I'm right side brain thinking (I'm left handed) but the programing for all of my locks was a little difficult. BUT this one was the worst. The timing between the program steps is too short and times out leaving no time to read the next step. You must memorize the six steps and perform them flawlessly or you'll find yourself doing a factory reset and starting over. If you are not using the Landlord mode it should go easier. A second person reading the instructions to you would be a great asset. Read all of the instructions over twice before starting the programing to understand the different modes. I love the lock now that it is installed but I never did get the Landlord mode working.

data.title: missing handle screws
data.body: Let me start by saying I bought 2 of these locks, because I liked the first one so much. However, both keyless doors locks were missing the set screws for the door handle. I was able to rig up a solution to make it work, but to have both sets missing parts is disappointing.

data.title: A Pain To Install
data.body:
UPDATE- 3/24: So I'm using this as any normal person would and the handle comes off in my hand for no good reason. This has never happened with any other door handle I've installed, and I've installed many. It's a good thing I kept the manual and was able to put it back on. I knew I didn't like this for a reason. Too bad I'm outside my return window. Find another lock and save yourself the headache. Berlin Modish is a great product that I should've gone with but I was looking for a specific finish to match this door.

ORIGINAL REVIEW -2/24:
I had to watch a few videos to get the full gist of how to install this lock. I've installed several others over the past few years and this was the least intuitive. It works but I wouldn't purchase this brand again. I'll stick with the competition.

data.title: Great upgrade
data.body: Easily installed and works great. Love the key code function for entry. For replacement it is easy to rekey to match the old locks

data.title: These licks have worked fantastic.
data.body: I don’t believe you should be asking for a review so quickly after their arrival. With that being said, we have one that has been on the outside of our building for 4 years. We have had no problems with it. It is open to rain, snow, wind and any adverse weather conditions thrown at us over the years. The only thing that has happened is we have had to replace the batteries a couple of times. These will be on the inside of our building and so I hope they continue to work as well. We have a B&B and so many people come and go and combinations have been changed repeatedly. I’m glad to report there have been no real problems.

data.title: Wow. Well made.
data.body: Someone spent some effort on design and engineering. Very well though out. Very well executed. Way better than all the other cheap stuff out there on half my other doors. Ordered 2 more.

data.title: Good lock
data.body: Hard to install

data.title: Read the instruction to install correctly
data.body:
Use this to replace an old Kwikset door lock. It has the same hole requirement so I just use the existing latch and simply install the exterior and interior assemblies.
The installation guide provides important info to install it correctly. "The outside handle should have the setscrew hole facing down. Insert and turn the provided key to the horizontal position then line up the handle setscrew hole with the PRE-INSTALLED setscrew and tighten it". I saw several reviews complaining about missing set screw and design flaw as the hole is facing up. The reviewers probably didn't read the instructions.
Programming is old style and not intuitive. I also have to factory reset before programming my user codes successfully. I do like the auto lock feature. Happy that I can now have keyless entry and auto lock door.

data.title: Easy to install
data.body: Use for my garage door entry. Works very nice and super easy to setup. Been using for about 2 months

data.title: Easy to install
data.body: High quality, easy to rekey any kwickset lock

data.title: Good replacement
data.body: Our old one was burning through batteries every week, so bought this one to replace it. Works great, and my family loves that they got to pick their own codes. Haven't had to replace batteries since purchasing.

data.title: Beautiful locks
data.body: These are perfect for any home. We used them at our rental property. It helps people from being locked out and it’s very easy to reprogram. It was also cheaper than the options at Lowe’s so great value

data.title: Put it in my garage side door.
data.body: It work as expected. I wish it had an apps to control and monitor it. But then it would be really expensive. For how much it is, it’s great.

data.title: Excellent
data.body: Excellent quality, well made, seems to be worth the cost and then some! Very pleased with this purchase!

data.title: Nice lock set
data.body: At first I thought it was missing parts like the set screw for the Handel but discovered how it was designed. I've had it for a few months now and it's been working great. I would like to buy some more for my other doors.

data.title: Solid, easy to program
data.body:
I chose this digital lock because it claims a long battery life (no Wi-Fi), multiple codes, and is 'commercial' standard i.e. durable. Seem physically robust.

It was easy, but not trivial, to fit. Easy to enter and remove codes that open the lock.

The only drawback so far, for my purposes, is that although it allows 30 codes, and allows one-time codes. you can only enter a single one-time code at a time. Adding a second overwrites the first, so you can't set up a bunch of them and hand them out as needed to the cleaning crew or plumber etc. as needed.

You have to physically go to the lock to enter a new one when the single one-time code get used up. An odd design choice IMHO. I would rather have multiple one-time codes and fewer permanent codes.

data.title: The best
data.body:
This lock is the best to be had, (in my opinion.) I have two, plus the deadbolt version, on three doors now, and an extra one, new in box to replace another lesser brand when it fails. Very solid and sturdy unit that exudes high quality, and as a bonus; quite economical as well. Easy to install and program, and it uses a single 9 volt battery vs.
many others with a cumberson rack of AA batteries. I highly recommend this lock since each of mine have worked perfectly.this unit is rated for commercial duty, and I'm sure it would be very good for hotels, B&Bs, etc.

data.title: Used for storage room door
data.body: I've been looking for a kwikset unit like this for use on a lockable doorhandle to the storage room door on the back of my townhouse. I have other kwikset electronic locks on other doors where I've replaced the deadbolts so I could use a code. This handled unit compliments those locks on my front and back doors which I can set similar or unique codes for each one. All can handle up to 30 unique codes which is way more than plenty for my need. Having the smartkey system was a specific need so that all my locks will also work with the same key. It's been installed about a week and works great. Installation was as simple as it gets, removed the old handle lock and this fit right in place in about 5 minutes. Handle is reversible so can be used for left or right hand door needs. Takes a 9v bolt which is included. This is different from my other units that take 4AA batteries. You will hear the lock disengage when you enter the code and then it will re engage after about 10 seconds so when you close the door it's automatically locked. I used to leave my storeroom/shed door unlocked for convenience which was unsecure. Now I don't have to worry about that as it's always automatically locked when I close it and don't have to carry a key.

data.title: Great replacement for 5 button Kwikset
data.body:
We've had a 5 button Kwikset lock on our door for quite a few years. It was easy to punch in the code (can hit all numbers pretty quick with your thumb, hand on handle) but the mechanism was terrible. It sometimes unlocked right away, other times it would take 5 cycles, or not unlock at all. It also always automatically locked every time unless you unscrewed the cover and flipped a dip switch in the back then it would always stay unlocked unless you push the lock button. And the battery tray was terrible, had to take 2 Allen head screws out, and I actually had to take my dead bolt off to slide tray out. Probably got over a year out of the batteries, but still an ordeal.

This is great in comparison, except the key pad. It's not bad, actually 2x more secure having more buttons, just the 5 button was easier to punch in code. But everything else is better. The lock disengages quickly and reliably, and the thumb turn in back to switch from automatic locking to passage (ideal for us if we're working in the yard or out on the porch). This uses a 9v battery thats easy to get in and out, and no screws in the cover, so easy to change.

The programming is a bit of a pain, for me anyways. The instructions didn't make it clear that you have to press the program button, the 1, then the kw key, then the code you want, then the kw key. But I figured it out and all good.

data.title: Easy install
data.body: So easy to install I bought a second one for another door.

data.title: IT'S BEEN A WEEK AND I LOVE IT!
data.body: All knob sets in my home are Kwikset products so I was eager to try this. It was very easy to install. I did have an issue with programming, but that was because I misread the instructions. Customer service is very easy to access. The customer service reps are knowledgeable and eager to help. I had it programmed in about 1 minute. I love the look of the unit, and it is so easy to understand and operate. I just ordered a second one for another entry point in my home.

data.title: Awesome product great function
data.body: Performs great feels heavy duty more options than my previous lock. Really happy with this.

data.title: Awesome upgrade from old design. Excellent.
data.body: I ordered these to replace two Kwikset Smart Key locks which had died due to battery damage; my fault. They were on doors not used frequently and I was just being lazy. And the batteries exploded damaging the circuit board. Again, my fault. They were twenty years old and we really enjoy the convenience and wanted the same thing. Well, they are not the same, they are BETTER! The "new" design uses 9 volt batteries which can be changed without using a hex key to remove the cover. The old ones were 4 AAA's and hidden under a cover accessible only by using the aforementioned hex key. They install easier as well as the new design has one fewer mounting plate. It also programs much easier. And the old ones had dip switches to change to open mode verses autolocking which was under the cover requiring a hex key; the new one has it external and is a great, no, a wonderful upgrade. How much do I like this design? I am changing my other two twenty year old locks next!
